Package algonquin.cst2335.finalprojectandroid

Class RecipeSearchActivityTest

java.lang.Object
algonquin.cst2335.finalprojectandroid.RecipeSearchActivityTest
public class RecipeSearchActivityTest extends Object
File name: RecipeSearchActivityTest.java Author: Tsaichun Chang Course: CST2335-022 Assignment: Final Project Date: 2024-03-29
Version:
1 Test class for RecipeSearchActivity to verify the correct behavior of the activity. Uses Espresso for UI testing to simulate user interactions and verify the state of the activity.
Author:
Tsaichun Chang

  • Field Details

    • activityRule

      public androidx.test.ext.junit.rules.ActivityScenarioRule<RecipeSearchActivity> activityRule
      Rule to launch the RecipeSearchActivity before each test method. This rule provides functional testing of a single activity.

  • Constructor Details

    • RecipeSearchActivityTest

      public RecipeSearchActivityTest()

  • Method Details

    • testActivityLaunch

      public void testActivityLaunch()
      Tests that the RecipeSearchActivity is not null when launched, ensuring the activity can be instantiated and displayed.

    • testSnackbarAppearanceOnEmptySearch

      public void testSnackbarAppearanceOnEmptySearch()
      Tests that a Snackbar appears when attempting a search with an empty query. This verifies that the application correctly handles empty search queries by notifying the user.

    • testSharedPreferencesSavesLastSearch

      public void testSharedPreferencesSavesLastSearch()
      Tests that the last search term entered by the user is saved and restored correctly using SharedPreferences. This simulates the scenario where a user exits and re-enters the application, expecting their last search term to be remembered.

    • testValidSearchInput

      public void testValidSearchInput()
      Tests that a valid search query can be entered into the search field and submitted. This test simulates a user entering a search term and pressing the search button, but does not verify the result of the search.

    • testUserGuideAlertDialog

      public void testUserGuideAlertDialog()
      Tests that the user guide AlertDialog is displayed when the appropriate menu item is selected. This verifies that the user can access help information from within the application.
